introduction.paragraph: This request brings the specified database online, either immediately or after a specified delay. Bringing a database online:

unordered-list.list-item: Re-establishes access to the database through the Public REST API.

introduction.paragraph: For more information about taking a database offline and bringing it back online, see Taking databases offline and bringing them online.

section.title: Bringing a database online that is going offline

body.note: This is a special and probably unusual case.
body.paragraph: Following are the effects of bringing a database online that is in the process of going offline:

unordered-list.list-item: Online immediately: The _online call will be executed after the _offline call completes.

Online after a time delay: There are two cases:
If after the delay, the database is already online, then no action is taken. If after the delay, the database is going offline, then the _online call will run as soon as the database is offline.
Bring a database online immediately: Make the REST call with no message body.
Bring a database online after a time delay: Make the REST call with a message body that specifies the delay.

body.paragraph: This form of the API request brings the database online immediately.
The request uses the following header:
This request does not use query parameters.
This request does not use a message body.

section.title: Bring database online after a delay

body.paragraph: This form of the API request brings the database online after a specified delay (in seconds).
The request uses the following header:
This request does not use query parameters.
The message body is a JSON document that contains the following objects:

row.entry: Delay in seconds before bringing the database online

unordered-list.list-item: 502 Bad Gateway – Unable to connect to server
503 Service Unavailable – Database resync is in progress

body.paragraph: This response uses only standard HTTP headers.
The following request takes the database named cookbook online.
body.code-block:
POST /cookbook/_session HTTP/1.1 Host: localhost:59840 Content-Type: application/json
{ "name": "chef123", "ttl": 1800 }
body.paragraph: Following is the response for the request above:
body.code-block:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 140 Content-Type: application/json Server: Couchbase Sync Gateway
{ "cookie_name": "SyncGatewaySession", "expires": "2014-11-07T16:42:11.675519255-08:00", "session_id": "c2425fa7d734bc8c3f6c507854166bef56a5fbc6" }
